headache.title: For headaches, here are some recommendations:
recommendations: Stay hydrated - drink at least 8 glasses of water daily
Rest in a dark, quiet room to reduce sensory stimulation
Apply a cold or warm compress to your head or neck
Practice relaxation techniques like deep breathing
If headaches persist for more than 3 days, consult a healthcare provider
Keep track of potential triggers (stress, certain foods, lack of sleep)

migraine.title: For migraines, consider these steps:
recommendations: Move to a quiet, dark room immediately
Use cold compresses on your head and neck
Practice stress-management techniques
Keep a migraine diary to identify triggers
Consider preventive medications if migraines are frequent

fever.title: If you have a fever, follow these guidelines:
recommendations: Monitor your temperature regularly
Stay hydrated with water and clear fluids
Get plenty of rest

recommendations.title: Take fever-reducing medications:
items: Ibuprofen if recommended by healthcare provider

recommendations: Use a lukewarm compress
Wear light clothing and keep room temperature comfortable

cold.title: For managing a common cold:
recommendations: Get plenty of rest to help your body fight the infection
Try saline nasal drops or sprays
Use a humidifier in your room
Gargle with warm salt water
Consider zinc supplements or vitamin C
Practice good hygiene to prevent spreading

anxiety.title: For managing anxiety:
recommendations: Practice deep breathing exercises regularly
Maintain a consistent sleep schedule
Exercise regularly
Limit caffeine and alcohol intake
Maintain a support network
